reviews.sentence: Livid festival. Just enjoyed a weekend of sport in Sydney and used the Mantra Chatswod as a base. Great location close to transport and took the opportunity to take a look at the Vivid festival on The Concourse in Chatswod. Amazing light show worth a look.

Good location Needs new appliances. Great pool spa sauna. Close to transport shops2 surcharge on credit card. Advertised with King size bed only Queen bed provided. Asked for Quiet room given first floor above reception. Poor quality toaster kettle. Fridge leaking.

Great for families. It was great to stay with the kids there the 2 bedrooms accommodation is great very spacious with all you need. The pool spa and gym are great too. We really enjoy our stay even thought the wifi was nt free and i thought it was a bit of a downside considering the star rating of this hotel. The breakfast was good you just ca nt get hot chocolate or special coffees for free its an extra charge. Most hotels we have stayed at we had someone coming to our table asking us if we like a coffee and hot chocolates were also available at no fees. Children do nt drink tea or coffee all they could have was juices which are nt fresh so hello sugar at the morning or some cold milk from the cereal bar a bit disappointing for us. Otherwise it was great and we would stay again.

Chatswod stay. Location good and very close to train and buses. 2mins to Sydney CBD. Standard experience and prices competitive. Good choice of shops and restaurants in waking distance. Pool spa and gym clean and tidy.

Chatswod and a movie. Great location great value close to facilities very clean and great staff. Breakfast was a bit of a let down not a great selection and eggs were dry. Overall really enjoyed our stay and the gym and pool was good.

Family fun. Easter weekend at Mantra Chatswod with family including two grandsons aged 3 6. Perfect place to relax and enjoy Sydney. Mantra is across the road from the train station and shopping centre. Easy trip to Luna Park and then ferry ride to Circular Quay. The indoor pool on level one was superb for a bubbly spa warming sauna or swim in the pool. The boys enjoyed caramel filled Easter eggs from the front desk every time we left or arrived back to the hotel. We had two rooms on 4th floor. The staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms had cooking facilities if we needed. Comfortable beds and very clean romscanot wait to visit again. Thankyou for such an enjoyable break away.

Average. The hotel is average not the best but not the worst. I booked before checking TripAdvisor which I do not usually do but it was better than I anticipated after reading the reviews and I would stay again if I got a good deal. Pros. Room is large spacious bright and well equipped. Pool and spa are nice although the jets in the spa were not working during our stay. I did not get to use the gym but it is well equipped. Location is excellent very close to the train station Westfield and tonnes of places to eat or grab a drink. Staff were friendly and efficient. Breakfast was good. good selection and varietyBed was comfortable and large. Cons Old and tired cracking ceilings peeling paint etc. Noise from the trains and highway although did not keep me awake. Finishes in the room not good tiles in the kitchen looking dirty and even mouldy. Parking is expensive at 25 night. Air con not cold enough bedroom got hot over night even though I had it on 18 and the zone on bedroom. If they did a good renovation and sorted out the issues with the rooms being dated it would be much nicer. But there are a lot of pros so I would actually stay again only for a good deal though.

Cozy. I really loved this short business trip of mine only because of Mantra Chatswod hotel. The apartments were spacious enough to do your exercise invite your friends over. The noise of the trains did not really bothered me as such. The only thing i felt was wrong was the daily wifi usage limit. ITs only 1 GB per day which is not at all enough. Hope they will increase it. Otherwise i would still want this hotel next time i visit sydney.

A Night at the Mantra. My husband and I stay at the Mantra in Chatswod whenever we overnight in Sydney. The location is great for us the rooms are very comfortable and clean and the staff are friendly and accommodating. I like that the suits are spacious and I do not feel crowded I. as I do I some hotel rooms. My husband loves the pool and the sauna.

Comfy pretty clean. Breakfast very good. Initial room we were put in smelled of mildew so while we were out our belongings were moved for us into a room which did not smell and had a balcony bonus. Sauna and lap pool were fantastic. Also diagonally across from Chatswod station. Small minus is the price of parking 25 nightly was harsh. Overall though a comfortable stay thanksVentilation. Price of parking. Needed decaf coffee at breakfast buffet.

Upgrade refurbishment needed. See previous comments submitted on lineNo plugsBroken clothes lineLift cards not working smothlyAir conditioning porFridge ice box not working Shower floods bathroom florNo local information in room on Mantra restaurants activities etc.

Location convenience brand reputation. Comfortable acomodating. Suggest maintenance attend to Level 3 button in the left side lift seems stuck Update gym equipment for safety cables on weight machine appears worn surprised no towels down the gym. a sign to say ‘ bring your towel down ’ would be great as I do n’t always read the room compendium Dining bar funky lounge styling was a nice touch though.

Lift was cause of annoyance building under renovation not notified to me before stay staff helpful. Staff was friendly and helpful. Mantra should have stipulated that the building was under renovation we could not open our windows. No towels at swimming pool and spa did not workthe lift button was not working and resulted in awkward trips up and down the building very unhappy about this.

Probably wo nt stay here again. The hotel is getting pretty ragedy carpet old and stained and needs replacement. Shower was terrible. TV channel selection was tiny. Doors have lots of marks on them. Gym has sanitising wipes dispenser but it never any wipes in it to clean the equipment. My room had a dryer but no washing machine. A safe in each room would be very helpful its been a long time since I have stayed in a hotel room that does not have one. Check in staff were very polite and efficient.

No hot water Cold shower. After spending many nights at the Chatswod Mantra over the years I can not say how disappointed I was on my most recent stay. Aircon not working. Gym equipment faulty and in very poor rusty and partially repaired. Free weights laying around the cardio equipment very dangerous. No hot water for a shower in the morning. Whilst the hot water was fixed on the second day of my stay the memory of a cold shower will not be fixed so fast. No apology or offer of discount from the reception staff just advice that the hot water had been fixed. I will be staying elsewhere in future.

I had a positive experience staying at your establishment. My experience at your hotel was a positive one the only part of it I found lacking in support was the fact of the signs in the gym and pool area were not tactile visually impaired people this could be a safety issue as it is very hard to negotiate and operate the equipment.

Average. Central location if you ’re working around Chatswod. Very dated decor not even a single chair on the balcony just an open deck. What ’s the point of even having a deck if you ca n’t sit down and enjoy the view. Every time I had a shower the WHOLE bathroom would get flooded. Could n’t avoid it if I tried. The sauna down stairs has a sign saying “ Dry sauna do not pour water on ”. They obviously do n’t know how a sauna works. This sauna is identical to every other sauna which allows water on the rocks. Absolutely ridiculous. When I checked in I asked the concierge for a room with a view high up. My room was surrounded by other buildings. My view was literally a brick wall 15 feet away. Thanks guys. Mini bar was a joke do n’t even get me started. Just a really average hotel service apartment block that seems to be way overpriced for what it offers. 25 stars at best. Wo n’t be returning.
Just Okay Tired hotel have not been updated or deep cleaned in a while. Gym equipment was clunky loud and some not working.

Lovely Room fantastic staff good food they are improving. I checked in early 11 am knowing my room might not be ready but they said it was only to go up find is was not ready but received a complimentary bottle of red wine when it was finally ready at 2 pm bonusThey were doing renovation work on one of the floors so the lift floors were always dirty but that can be forgiven my room had a very new carpet almost chemical smell but I was able to air it with the window open. but the tragedy what I was really looking forward to was the spa in the gym. It did n’t work. No bubbles or hot jets of water to ease aches just tub of warm water with sandy bits at the bottom ☹ ️.

Well Located for our needs. Moved three rooms as we were staying for a week. The first one Level 9 had the lounge made up as a bed as requested but we are elderly and would have had to make the bed every night to watch TV which was not acceptable. Level 2 room 201 was so gloomy and right next to the air vents was just terrible and we were down in Sydney to sort my Brother in Laws Estate which still a very stressful exercise and ongoing. The last unit 512 was lovely and under the circumstances was a lot happier. Please see that there are enough coat hangers for trousers etc.
